content: >http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/05/27/AR2009052700660.html The first reports are starting to come in of the effect of military operations against the Taliban in NE Pakistan provinces. Par for the course, civilian casualties far exceed government or militant losses. Hammered by government air, artillery and direct fire during protracted curfew periods, civilians are punished, as well, by increasingly suspicious and desperate militant forces. Surviving refugees are atarting to fill hospitals at further remove from fighting areas. They bring their stories with them, and these are being picked up by media outside the blacked-out operational areas. Any guesses on who'll wear the blame for this? This message has been edited. Last edited by: AliBubba, Wed 27 May 2009 06:42 AM
reply: >http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/05/27/AR2009052700660.html The first reports are starting to come in of the effect of military operations against the Taliban in NE Pakistan provinces. Par for the course, civilian casualties far exceed government or militant losses. Hammered by government air, artillery and direct fire during protracted curfew periods, civilians are punished, as well, by increasingly suspicious and desperate militant forces. Surviving refugees are atarting to fill hospitals at further remove from fighting areas. They bring their stories with them, and these are being picked up by media outside the blacked-out operational areas. Any guesses on who'll wear the blame for this? This message has been edited. title: Civilians Being Swatted in Pakistan

content: Press reports I have seen indicate the people tend to blame the Taliban and the Pak Government equally- the Taliban for acting like bloodthirsty barbarians after they move into an area and the Government for their heavy-handed, conventional military response. Government forces are poorly prepared to conduct CI/CT operations against the Taliban in large part because they have been overly focused on the conventional threat from India.
